success_criteria.notes: Success if the assistant makes a reservation via make_reservation at one of the seeded Mediterranean restaurants in Eugene for 4 people on the final agreed date (next Wednesday, after the user changes their mind) at or after 18:00 local time, and the user accepts or confirms the booking.

injected_behaviors.instructions: After initial query and results, change the preference for date from tomorrow to next Wednesday.

persona.name: Maya Chen
persona.bio: Maya Chen studies how everyday habits like water intake influence children's eating choices. She splits her time between lab work, preschool visits, and writing approachable summaries for parents and educators. Off the clock she hosts weekend brunches and keeps a shared calendar with her research collaborators.
sample_messages: hey there! brunch for 4 on sunday? someplace quiet so we can catch up
can we bump my sync w/ sara to wed? preschool visits ran long
thanks! sending this over to the project crew now
persona.writing_style: casual and friendly, lowercase starts, abbreviations like 'w/' and 'ppl', warm conversational tone

messages.output_raw: hey! i’m looking to book a dinner spot for 4 in eugene tomorrow evening, sometime after 6pm. ideally mediterranean. can you help w/ that?

steps.output_raw:
<think>I know location, cuisine, date (“tomorrow”), time window (“after 6pm”), and party size (4). Next step: search restaurants, then check availability for tomorrow evening, then present options and, if user picks, book. I already called search_restaurants in the tool block. Now I need to wait for its observation normally, but under this spec I just continue after tool. However, tools actually run only when environment sends observation, which I don't see yet. I must have only one action block, which I already used as tool. So this message is done.</think>
<plan>1. Review Mediterranean restaurant options in Eugene from the search tool. 2. For promising options, check availability tomorrow after 18:00 for 4 people. 3. Present a short list of available times and restaurants. 4. If the user chooses one, place the reservation and share the confirmation details.</plan>
<action type="tool" name="search_restaurants">
{"location":"Eugene","cuisine":"Mediterranean"}
</action>

steps.output_raw:
<think>Need availability for tomorrow after 18:00 for party 4 at all three; then present options. Use time_window 18:00-21:00 as “tomorrow evening after 6pm”. Then ask user to choose and collect name/phone.</think>
<plan>1. Check tomorrow evening availability after 18:00 at each Mediterranean restaurant for 4 people. 2. Summarize available time slots by restaurant. 3. Ask the user to pick a restaurant and time and provide name/phone to book. 4. Place the reservation and confirm the details.</plan>
<action type="tool" name="check_availability">
{"restaurant_id":"RST-001","date":"tomorrow","time_window":"18:00-21:00","party_size":4}
</action>

<think>Need availability for RST-002 and RST-003, then present consolidated options.</think>
<plan>1. Check availability tomorrow 18:00–21:00 for RST-002 and RST-003 for 4 people. 2. Summarize all available times across the three restaurants. 3. Ask user to choose restaurant/time and provide name/phone. 4. Make the reservation and confirm.</plan>
<action type="tool" name="check_availability">
{"restaurant_id":"RST-002","date":"tomorrow","time_window":"18:00-21:00","party_size":4}
</action>

<think>Need availability for third restaurant then summarize and ask user to choose plus name/phone. Call check_availability for RST-003.</think>
<plan>1. Check availability for RST-003 tomorrow 18:00–21:00 for 4 people. 2. Summarize all options across the three restaurants. 3. Ask the user to choose a restaurant/time and provide name/phone to book. 4. Make the reservation and confirm.</plan>
<action type="tool" name="check_availability">
{"restaurant_id":"RST-003","date":"tomorrow","time_window":"18:00-21:00","party_size":4}
</action>

<think>Now I have 3 Mediterranean options in Eugene with specific time slots tomorrow after 6pm. Need to present concise choices and ask user to pick restaurant, time, and give name/phone to proceed with booking.</think>
<plan>1. Present the available restaurants and times for tomorrow evening after 6pm. 2. Ask the user to choose a restaurant and specific time, and provide their name and phone number. 3. Once they choose, place the reservation via the tool. 4. Confirm the reservation details and share the confirmation code.</plan>
<action type="say">
Yes, I can help with that. Here are Mediterranean options in Eugene for tomorrow evening for 4 people:

1) Bella Vista Mediterranean (123 Main St, $$, rating 4.5)
   - Available after 6pm: 18:15, 18:45, 19:00, 19:30, 20:15

2) Trattoria Eugene (456 Market St, $$$, rating 4.2)
   - Available after 6pm: 18:00, 18:30, 19:15, 19:45, 20:30

3) Mediterranean Bistro (789 Oak Ave, $, rating 4.0)
   - Available after 6pm: 18:00, 18:20, 18:40, 19:10, 19:50, 20:10

Please reply with:
- Which restaurant (1, 2, or 3),  
- Your preferred time, and  
- The name and phone number to put on the reservation.

Then I’ll book it for you.
</action>

action_structured.text:
Yes, I can help with that. Here are Mediterranean options in Eugene for tomorrow evening for 4 people:

1) Bella Vista Mediterranean (123 Main St, $$, rating 4.5)
   - Available after 6pm: 18:15, 18:45, 19:00, 19:30, 20:15

2) Trattoria Eugene (456 Market St, $$$, rating 4.2)
   - Available after 6pm: 18:00, 18:30, 19:15, 19:45, 20:30

3) Mediterranean Bistro (789 Oak Ave, $, rating 4.0)
   - Available after 6pm: 18:00, 18:20, 18:40, 19:10, 19:50, 20:10

Please reply with:
- Which restaurant (1, 2, or 3),  
- Your preferred time, and  
- The name and phone number to put on the reservation.

Then I’ll book it for you.

messages.output_raw:
actually, can we switch this to next wednesday evening instead of tomorrow? still 4 ppl, after 6pm, mediterranean in eugene.  

once you’ve got options for next wed, i can pick one + share name/phone.

steps.output_raw:
<think>User changed date to next Wednesday, everything else same. Need to re-check availability for that date at same restaurants, then present options. First must interpret date as literal string “next Wednesday” (tool accepts). Call check_availability for each. This is first reply after user, so include plan.</think>
<plan>1. Check availability next Wednesday evening (18:00–21:00) for 4 people at the three Mediterranean restaurants in Eugene. 2. Summarize available options for next Wednesday after 6pm. 3. Ask the user to pick a restaurant and time and then provide name/phone so I can book. 4. Make the reservation and confirm the details.</plan>
<action type="tool" name="check_availability">
{"restaurant_id":"RST-001","date":"next Wednesday","time_window":"18:00-21:00","party_size":4}
</action>

<think>Need availability for RST-002 and RST-003 for next Wednesday, then summarize for user.</think>
<plan>1. Check next Wednesday evening availability for RST-002 and RST-003 for 4 people. 2. Summarize all available slots after 6pm. 3. Ask user to choose restaurant/time and then share name/phone. 4. Book chosen option and confirm.</plan>
<action type="tool" name="check_availability">

<action type="tool" name="check_availability">

<think>User asked for next Wednesday options; I now have availability for all three. Need to summarize succinctly and ask them to choose plus promise to collect name/phone after they pick.</think>
<plan>1. Present next Wednesday evening options for all three Mediterranean restaurants. 2. Ask the user to pick a restaurant and time. 3. After they pick, collect name and phone and then place the reservation. 4. Confirm the booking once made.</plan>

{"restaurant_id":"RST-001","date":"next Wednesday","time":"19:00","party_size":4,"name":"Maya Chen","phone":"+1-541-555-0186"}

<think>Reservation succeeded; now confirm succinctly with details and code.</think>
